title.narrative: MULTI-SECTORAL INTERVENTIONS FOR REFUGEE & MIGRANT CHILDREN IN CRITICAL LOCATIONS

description.narrative: By 2020, central and local authorities in critical locations hosting refugee and migrant children have increased capacity to plan and manage a multi-sectoral response to the needs of vulnerable children, which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance (Covid), Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the education, child and social protection and health systems, NGOs, communities and families provide vulnerable children with increasingly inclusive opportunities to realize their rights to protection, education, development and participationBy 2020, the education, child and social protection and health systems, NGOs, communities and families provide vulnerable children with increasingly inclusive opportunities to realize their rights to protection, education, development and participation.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, central and local authorities in critical locations hosting refugee and migrant children have increased capacity to planand manage a multi-sectoral response to the needs of vulnerable children

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to provide essential multi-sectoral services to refugee and vulnerable Turkish children in critical locations with high concentration of refugees and migrants. The scope of this work has been expanded to address the impact of Covid-19 outbreak, with a particular focus on infection prevention and control at the household level. | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/01/2021

Administrative guidelines for child protection in removal centers adopted and operationalized (63896), Text

baseline.value: Administrative guidelines exist for the general management of protection issues in removal centers, but are not child-friendly

target.value: 2020:Administrative guidelines to specifically manage child protection issues in removal centers are adopted

actual.value: 2020:Administrative guidelines developed and their operationalization is being tested

title.narrative: Local coordination mechanisms established to ensure inter-sectoral coordinated approaches for the implementation of local actions/policies in favour of refugee and other vulnerable children(61249), Text

baseline.value: Local coordination mechanisms non existant in the municipalities/provinces of the South East
